casebody.data:
AMBASSADOR HOTEL CO., Plaintiff—Appellee, v. WEI-CHUAN INVESTMENT; J&L Enterprises; Jeff Guey Yae Chen, Defendants, and Huei Shyong Huang; Jau H. Huang; Wei-Chuan Construction & Development, Inc., Defendants—Appellants. No. 01-56043. D.C. No. CV-90-06626-RMT. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Submitted March 15, 2002.* Decided March 25, 2002.

Before KOZINSKI and GOULD, Circuit Judges, and CEBULL, District Judge.**

This panel unanimously finds this case suitable for decision without oral argument. See Fed. R.App. P. 34(a)(2).

The Honorable Richard F. Cebull, United States District Judge for the District of Montana, sitting by designation.

MEMORANDUM***

Substantial evidence supports the damages award, and the district court’s computation of damages was not clearly erroneous. See Ambassador Hotel Co. v. Wei*590Chuan Inv., 189 F.3d 1017, 1024 (9th Cir. 1999). The district court did not abuse its discretion in awarding punitive damages. See Yeti by Molly Ltd. v. Deckers Outdoor Corp., 259 F.3d 1101, 1111 (9th Cir.2001).

AFFIRMED.

This disposition is not appropriate for publication and may not be cited to or by the courts of this circuit except as may be provided by 9th Circuit Rule 36-3.
